log.input:
Please write a Vpython code for "Simple Harmonic Motion Caused by Electrostatic Force (Circular Ring, Placed Above the Vertical Line)"

In a three-dimensional ring at (0, 0, 0) with a radius of 10, a small ball with a radius of 0.3 is released from position (0, 3, 0) and starts to undergo simple harmonic motion caused by the electrostatic force between two balls. The small ball can only move between (0, 3, 0) and (0, -3, 0). There is a yellow line connecting the centers of two blue large balls. At (0, 3, 0) and (0, -3, 0), there are two white horizontal lines each 5 cm in length.

Cyber Input Variable Mapping Information:

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(2) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(3) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math, sympy, scipy and time.
log.output:
from vpython import *

scene = canvas(title="Simple Harmonic Motion Caused by Electrostatic Force", width=600, height=600)

# Variables
Radius_I = 1
ball_radius = 0.3
ring_radius = 10.0
pos_top = vec(0, 3, 0)
pos_bottom = vec(0, -3, 0)
pos_center = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Creating Objects
ball = sphere(pos=pos_top, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball2 = sphere(pos=pos_bottom, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball3 = sphere(pos=pos_center, radius=ball_radius, color=color.blue)

ring = ring(pos=pos_center, axis=vec(0, 0, 1), radius=ring_radius, thickness=0.1)
line = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=pos_top-pos_bottom, radius=0.05, color=color.yellow)
line_top = cylinder(pos=pos_top, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)
line_bottom = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)

# Variables for motion
k = 1e-4
m = 1e-3
t = 0
dt = 0.01
v = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Motion
while True:
    rate(100)
    F = k * ball.pos * mag(ball.pos)**-2
    a = F / m
    v = v + a*dt
    ball.pos = ball.pos + v*dt

    # Change the direction of motion when reaches top or bottom
    if abs(ball.pos.y) > 3:
        v.y = -v.y
        
    t = t + dt
    ball.radius = Radius_I
    ball2.radius = Radius_I

scene = canvas(title="Simple Harmonic Motion Caused by Electrostatic Force", width=600, height=600)

# Variables
Radius_I = 1
ring_radius = 10.0
pos_top = vec(0, 3, 0)
pos_bottom = vec(0, -3, 0)
pos_center = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Creating Objects
ball = sphere(pos=pos_top, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball1 = sphere(pos=pos_center, radius=1.5, color=color.blue)
ball2 = sphere(pos=-pos_center, radius=1.5, color=color.blue)

ring = ring(pos=pos_center, axis=vec(0, 0, 1), radius=ring_radius, thickness=0.1)

line = cylinder(pos=ball1.pos, axis=ball2.pos-ball1.pos, radius=0.03, color=color.yellow)

line1 = cylinder(pos=pos_top, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.03, color=color.white)
line2 = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.03, color=color.white)

# Variables for motion
t = 0
dt = 0.01
velocity = vec(0, -1, 0)

# Motion
while True:
    rate(100)
    if abs(ball.pos.y) > 3:
        velocity.y = -velocity.y
    ball.pos = ball.pos + velocity*dt
    t = t + dt
    ball.radius = Radius_I
    ball1.radius = 1.5
    ball2.radius = 1.5

scene = canvas(title="Simple Harmonic Motion Caused by Electrostatic Force", width=600, height=600)

# Variables
Radius_I = 1
ball_radius = 0.3
ring_radius = 10.0
pos_top = vec(0, 3, 0)
pos_bottom = vec(0, -3, 0)
pos_center = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Creating Objects
ball = sphere(pos=pos_top, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball2 = sphere(pos=pos_bottom, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball3 = sphere(pos=pos_center, radius=ball_radius, color=color.blue)

ring = ring(pos=pos_center, axis=vec(0, 0, 1), radius=ring_radius, thickness=0.1)
line = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=pos_top-pos_bottom, radius=0.05, color=color.yellow)
line_top = cylinder(pos=pos_top, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)
line_bottom = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)

# Variables for motion
k = 1e-4
m = 1e-3
t = 0
dt = 0.01
v = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Motion
while True:
    rate(100)
    F = k * ball.pos * mag(ball.pos)**-2
    a = F / m
    v = v + a*dt
    ball.pos = ball.pos + v*dt

    # Change the direction of motion when reaches top or bottom
    if abs(ball.pos.y) > 3:
        v.y = -v.y
        
    t = t + dt
    ball.radius = Radius_I
    ball2.radius = Radius_I
    ball3.radius = ball_radius
    ring.radius = ring_radius
    line.radius = 0.05
    line_top.radius = 0.05
    line_bottom.radius = 0.05

ring_radius = 10.0
pos_top = vec(0, 3, 0)
pos_bottom = vec(0, -3, 0)
pos_center = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Creating Objects
ball = sphere(pos=pos_top, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball2 = sphere(pos=pos_bottom, radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball3 = sphere(pos=pos_center, radius=ball_radius, color=color.blue)

ring = ring(pos=pos_center, axis=vec(0, 0, 1), radius=ring_radius, thickness=0.1)
line = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=pos_top-pos_bottom, radius=0.05, color=color.yellow)
line_top = cylinder(pos=pos_top, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)
line_bottom = cylinder(pos=pos_bottom, axis=vec(5, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.white)

# Variables for motion
k = 1e-4
m = 1e-3
t = 0
dt = 0.01
v = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Motion
while True:
    rate(100)
    F = -k * ball.pos * mag(ball.pos)**-2
    a = F / m
    v = v + a*dt
    ball.pos = ball.pos + v*dt

    # Change the direction of motion when reaches top or bottom
    if abs(ball.pos.y) > 3:
        v.y = -v.y
        
    t = t + dt
    ball.radius = Radius_I
    ball2.radius = Radius_I
